MOSQITO
  • mosqito.sound_level_meter

  • View page source
noct_spectrum(sig, fs, fmin, fmax, n=3, G=10, fr=1000)[source]ÔÉÅ

Compute nth-octave band spectrum

This function computes the rms level of a signal for each third octave band between the 2 limit frequencies.

Parameters:

  • sig (array_like) ‚Äì Time signal array with size (nperseg, nseg).

  • fs (float) ‚Äì Sampling frequency [Hz]

  • fmin (float) ‚Äì Minimum frequency band [Hz]

  • fmax (float) ‚Äì Maximum frequency band [Hz]

  • n (int) ‚Äì Number of bands per octave

  • G (int) ‚Äì System for specifying the exact geometric mean frequencies. Can be base 2 or base 10

  • fr (int) ‚Äì Reference frequency. Shall be set to 1 kHz for audible frequency range, to 1 Hz for infrasonic range (f < 20 Hz) and to 1 MHz for ultrasonic range (f > 31.5 kHz)

Returns:

  • spec (array_like) ‚Äì Third octave band spectrum of signal sig with size (nfreq, nseg)

  • fpref (array_like) ‚Äì Corresponding prefered third octave band center frequencies

See also

spectrum

spectrum computation from a time signal

noct_synthesis

conversion of a spectrum to n-th octave band levels

Examples

>>> from mosqito.sound_level_meter import noct_spectrum
>>> from mosqito.utils import amp2db
>>> import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
>>> import numpy as np
>>> f=1000
>>> fs=48000
>>> d=0.2
>>> dB=60
>>> time = np.arange(0, d, 1/fs)
>>> stimulus = np.sin(2 * np.pi * f * time) + 0.5 * np.sin(6 * np.pi * f * time)
>>> rms = np.sqrt(np.mean(np.power(stimulus, 2)))
>>> ampl = 0.00002 * np.power(10, dB / 20) / rms
>>> stimulus = stimulus * ampl
>>> spec, freq_axis = noct_spectrum(stimulus, fs, fmin=90, fmax=14000)
>>> spec_db = amp2db(spec, ref=2e-5)
>>> plt.step(freq_axis, spec_db)
>>> plt.xlabel("Center frequency [Hz]")
>>> plt.ylabel("Amplitude [dB]")

(Source code, png, hires.png, pdf)
